articles.author: Bernard Orr
articles.description: After sealing pledges of a new era of strategic partnership with China's Xi Jinping, Russian President Vladimir Putin on Friday is set to highlight the growing importance of trade near the Russian border in China's northeast.
articles.title: Putin to push growing Moscow-Beijing trade in China's northeast

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli forces battled Hamas fighters in the narrow alleyways of Jabalia in northern Gaza on Friday in some of the fiercest engagements since they returned to the area a week ago, while in the south militants attacked tanks massing around Rafah.
articles.title: Fierce fighting in northern Gaza as Israel defends itself at World Court

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukraine's top commander warned on Friday of "heavy battles" looming on the war's new front in the northeastern Kharkiv region as Russian President Vladimir Putin said Moscow was carving out a "buffer zone" in the area.
articles.title: Ukraine braces for 'heavy battles' as Putin says Russia carving out Kharkiv buffer zone

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israeli forces rescued the bodies of three hostages from the Gaza Strip, chief military spokesperson Daniel Hagari said on Friday.
articles.title: Israeli military says forces seized bodies of three hostages from Gaza

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Sonia Gandhi, the leader of India's Congress party, made an emotional appeal to voters in the family borough, asking them to vote for her son in a region that Prime Minister Narendra Modi and his party have dominated in the last ten years.
articles.title: Sonia Gandhi makes emotional appeal to voters on behalf of son

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A top Russian diplomat said on Friday the United States had long since entered into a state of indirect war with Moscow and was playing with fire over Ukraine by behaving in such a way that the situation could spin out of control.
articles.title: Russia says US 'playing with fire' in 'indirect war' with Moscow

articles.author: Ayhan Uyanik, Jan Lopatka
articles.description: Slovak doctors will meet on Monday to assess Prime Minister Robert Fico's health and discuss the possibility of transporting him from Banska Bystrica to the capital Bratislava, local media reported on Friday.
articles.title: Slovak doctors to discuss moving PM Fico to Bratislava on Monday, reports say

articles.author: Boldizsar Gyori, Kuba Stezycki, Jan Lopatka
articles.description: Slovak opposition party leader Michal Simecka, who described an assassination attempt on Prime Minister Robert Fico this week as an attack on democracy, said on Friday he that his wife and child had received death threats.
articles.title: Anger, anxiety, acrimony: Slovaks weigh what led to Fico shooting

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Three foreign tourists and one Afghan citizen were killed by gunmen in Afghanistan's central Bamyan province on Friday, the interior ministry said.
articles.title: Gunmen kill three foreign tourists in Afghanistan's central Bamyan province

articles.author: Alvise Armellini
articles.description: The Vatican issued new guidelines on Friday recommending a cautious approach to supposed supernatural events such as weeping Madonnas and blood-dripping crucifixes that have for centuries whipped up the Catholic faithful.
articles.title: Vatican urges caution over weeping Madonnas and other supposed apparitions
